channel.title: Zelda Oracles Game Engine - OS Project
channel.description:
Well... In case you haven't noticed, I love Zelda (Lin... k) and I've been really wanting another GB(C) adventure, but it never happened. I once made a decent engine in Game Maker, but the only problem was... It was made in Game Maker...
Anyhow, I'm trying to create a simple-to-work-with GBC Zelda Engine to work with (Link's Awakening (DX), Oracle of Seasons/Ages) so people can easily create their own games with it. It's being done in C# and since I'm no master with DirectX or anything else, it uses the GDI+.
My last game didn't go so well, as it was single-threaded and I did some things a horrible way... But I've learned from my mistakes and trying to keep this one decent with performance. So far, it's not going bad (After about 2 days maybe?)...
[b]Progress:[/b] -Tile engine done. -Allows tile animations. The animations are loaded from AT.dat and use the AT.bmp files for the tiles.
[b]To-do:[/b] -Allow the drawing engine to handle views (Like when scrolling from room to room) -Everything else... Sprites, combat, full header, music, sounds, combat, collisions (yuck)
I admit there's things I could've done better, and stuff I could've removed, but like I said, if it works, and well, then no need to change it. For now, I'm just posting so you can take a look at it... Flame me... And maybe see how you can do some things... Just don't leech :)
Screenshot (Old): [img]http://img223.imageshack.us/img223/4483/zeldatiletest.png[/img]
[b][url=http://uppit.com/v/H3KTSYTL]Download[/url][/b]
Oh and, you might notice an improper catch statement due to debugging purposes, and laziness.
~Lin

item.title: Zelda Oracles Game Engine - OS Project
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Alright. I’ve got a sprite base down, but there’s no animation yet. However, the animation engine for sprites is done, I just haven’t implemented it (Just need to increase/decrease frame ;))

And all those tiles in the back ARE animated.

item.title: Zelda Oracles Game Engine - OS Project
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Lin:

Alright, I’ve fixed an animated tile problem (Pretty major I guess. Only allowed one animated tile with others not working, or crashing) and then tested it with every tile as an animated one, and performance still great.

Good job, I am probably the only one that appreciates your work. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Zelda Oracles Game Engine - OS Project
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Well… In case you haven’t noticed, I love Zelda (Lin… k) and I’ve been really wanting another GB© adventure, but it never happened. I once made a decent engine in Game Maker, but the only problem was… It was made in Game Maker…

Anyhow, I’m trying to create a simple-to-work-with GBC Zelda Engine to work with (Link’s Awakening (DX), Oracle of Seasons/Ages) so people can easily create their own games with it. It’s being done in C# and since I’m no master with DirectX or anything else, it uses the GDI+.

My last game didn’t go so well, as it was single-threaded and I did some things a horrible way… But I’ve learned from my mistakes and trying to keep this one decent with performance. So far, it’s not going bad (After about 2 days maybe?)…

Progress:
-Tile engine done.
-Allows tile animations. The animations are loaded from AT.dat and use the AT.bmp files for the tiles.

To-do:
-Allow the drawing engine to handle views (Like when scrolling from room to room)
-Everything else… Sprites, combat, full header, music, sounds, combat, collisions (yuck)

I admit there’s things I could’ve done better, and stuff I could’ve removed, but like I said, if it works, and well, then no need to change it. For now, I’m just posting so you can take a look at it… Flame me… And maybe see how you can do some things… Just don’t leech

Download

Oh and, you might notice an improper catch statement due to debugging purposes, and laziness.
